content.question: A <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object is near a planet’s surface such that the gravitational field strength is <math alttext="4 newtons per kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. With what force is the planet attracted to the <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 newtons per kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
